page.content:
Churches in Crail The Church of Scotland Kirk of St. Mary which is 800 years old has many associations. e.g. Woman's Guild, Youth Fellowship, Sunday School, Bible Class and Choir. There are 560 members who attend regularly. During
the Summer we hold an early service for those wishing to spend the day elsewhere.. In July a Summer Mission team works for two weeks with the children, organising services, bible study, games and a coffee bar. We have recently sold our Church Hall to the District Council. As a step towards integration we hold Episcopal Communion services in St. mary's every 2 months. The Roman Catholic Church of the Most Holy Trinity is a branch of the Pittenweem Parish. There is a membership of 33.
